The FDA resumed high: risk food inspections on January 15, 2019, after Commissioner Scott Gottlieb announced that furloughed food inspectors would be recalled to work without pay.
The FDA: s press office provided an automated response stating that employees were on furlough, but Commissioner Gottlieb kept the public updated and informed through his Twitter account.
